metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Node.js MongoDB Insert
Insert Into Collection
To insert a record, or document as it is called in MongoDB, into a collection, we use the insertOne() method.
content.html: To insert a record, or document as it is called in MongoDB, into a collection, we use the insertOne() method.

content.text: A document in MongoDB is the same as a record in MySQL
content.html: A document in MongoDB is the same as a record in MySQL

content.text: The first parameter of the insertOne() method is an object containing the name(s) and value(s) of each field in the document you want to insert.
content.html: The first parameter of the insertOne() method is an object containing the name(s) and value(s) of each field in the document you want to insert.

content.text: It also takes a callback function where you can work with any errors, or the result of the insertion:
content.html: It also takes a callback function where you can work with any errors, or the result of the insertion:

content.code_html:
var MongoClient = require('mongodb').MongoClient;
var url = "mongodb://localhost:27017/";

MongoClient.connect(url, function(err, db) {
  if (err) throw err;
  var dbo = db.db("mydb");
  var myobj = { name: "Company Inc", address: "Highway 37" };
  dbo.collection("customers").insertOne(myobj, function(err, res) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("1 document inserted");
    db.close();
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_mongodb_insert.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_mongodb_insert.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_mongodb_insert.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:
content.html: Which will give you this result:

content.text: Note: If you try to insert documents in a collection that do not exist, MongoDB will create the collection automatically.
content.html: Note: If you try to insert documents in a collection that do not exist, MongoDB will create the collection automatically.

content.text: Insert Multiple Documents
To insert multiple documents into a collection in MongoDB, we use the insertMany() method.
content.html: To insert multiple documents into a collection in MongoDB, we use the insertMany() method.

content.text: The first parameter of the insertMany() method is an array of objects, containing the data you want to insert.
content.html: The first parameter of the insertMany() method is an array of objects, containing the data you want to insert.

content.text: It also takes a callback function where you can work with any errors, or the result of the insertion:
content.html: It also takes a callback function where you can work with any errors, or the result of the insertion:

content.code_html:
var MongoClient = require('mongodb').MongoClient;
var url = "mongodb://localhost:27017/";

MongoClient.connect(url, function(err, db) {
  if (err) throw err;
  var dbo = db.db("mydb");
  var myobj = [
    { name: 'John', address: 'Highway 71'},
    { name: 'Peter', address: 'Lowstreet 4'},
    { name: 'Amy', address: 'Apple st 652'},
    { name: 'Hannah', address: 'Mountain 21'},
    { name: 'Michael', address: 'Valley 345'},
    { name: 'Sandy', address: 'Ocean blvd 2'},
    { name: 'Betty', address: 'Green Grass 1'},
    { name: 'Richard', address: 'Sky st 331'},
    { name: 'Susan', address: 'One way 98'},
    { name: 'Vicky', address: 'Yellow Garden 2'},
    { name: 'Ben', address: 'Park Lane 38'},
    { name: 'William', address: 'Central st 954'},
    { name: 'Chuck', address: 'Main Road 989'},
    { name: 'Viola', address: 'Sideway 1633'}
  ];
  dbo.collection("customers").insertMany(myobj, function(err, res) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("Number of documents inserted: " + res.insertedCount);
    db.close();
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_mongodb_insert_multiple.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_mongodb_insert_multiple.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_mongodb_insert_multiple.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:
content.html: Which will give you this result:

content.code_html: Number of documents inserted: 14

content.text: The Result Object
When executing the insertMany() method, a result object is returned.
content.html: When executing the insertMany() method, a result object is returned.

content.text: The result object contains information about how the insertion affected the database.
content.html: The result object contains information about how the insertion affected the database.

content.text: The object returned from the example above looked like this:
content.html: The object returned from the example above looked like this:

content.text: The _id Field
If you do not specify an _id field, then MongoDB will add one for you and assign a unique id for each document.
content.html: If you do not specify an _id field, then MongoDB will add one for you and assign a unique id for each document.

content.text: In the example above no _id field was specified, and as you can see from the result object, MongoDB assigned a unique _id for each document.
content.html: In the example above no _id field was specified, and as you can see from the result object, MongoDB assigned a unique _id for each document.

content.text: If you do specify the _id field, the value must be unique for each document:
content.html: If you do specify the _id field, the value must be unique for each document:

content.code_html:
var MongoClient = require('mongodb').MongoClient;
var url = "mongodb://localhost:27017/";

MongoClient.connect(url, function(err, db) {
  if (err) throw err;
  var dbo = db.db("mydb");
  var myobj = [
    { _id: 154, name: 'Chocolate Heaven'},
    { _id: 155, name: 'Tasty Lemon'},
    { _id: 156, name: 'Vanilla Dream'}
  ];
  dbo.collection("products").insertMany(myobj, function(err, res) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log(res);
    db.close();
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_mongodb_insert_id.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_mongodb_insert_id.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_mongodb_insert_id.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:
content.html: Which will give you this result:

content.code_html:
{
  result: { ok: 1, n: 3 },
  ops: [
    { _id: 154, name: 'Chocolate Heaven },
    { _id: 155, name: 'Tasty Lemon },
    { _id: 156, name: 'Vanilla Dream } ],
  insertedCount: 3,
  insertedIds: [
    154,
    155,
    156 ]
}
